intro: Villadia albiflora, commonly known as the white-flowered villadia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces delicate white flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its botanical classification places it within the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
